publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-7785 Kenneth Gibson: Voices and Images of Yesterday—That the Parliament would like to congratulate Donald Reid, Beith Christian Action Group, Barrmill Jolly Beggars, Beith Camera Club and all others who have contributed to and made possible the publishing of the new local history book, Voices and Images of Yesterday and Today: Beith, Barmill & Gateside: Precious Memories, which will be launched in Beith Library on Thursday 27 January 2010; recognises the hard work, attention to detail and research over the past nine months that have culminated in this publication; acknowledges the importance of local history and literature in educating local schoolchildren and considers them an invaluable source of the rich heritage of family and social history of an area; welcomes the fact that the proceeds from book sales will be used to fund what are considered many worthy local causes, including Barrmill Community Association, the Beith branch of the Ayrshire Cancer Support Group and Barrmill Lads & Lassies Burns Club, and wishes everyone involved with the book launch a highly enjoyable evening and great success in their bid to raise money for the aforementioned causes. Supported by: Bill Kidd*
S3M-7785 Voices and Images of Yesterday (lodged on 25 January 2011) Jamie Hepburn*, Pauline McNeill*

S3M-7785 Voices and Images of Yesterday (lodged on 25 January 2011) Rob Gibson*, Andrew Welsh*, Willie Coffey*, Shirley-Anne Somerville*, Christina McKelvie*, Michael Matheson*, Christopher Harvie*, Joe FitzPatrick*, Gil Paterson*, Bill Wilson*, Stewart Stevenson*

S3M-7785 Kenneth Gibson: Voices and Images of Yesterday—That the Parliament would like to congratulate Donald Reid, Beith Christian Action Group, Barrmill Jolly Beggars, Beith Camera Club and all others who have contributed to and made possible the publishing of the new local history book, Voices and Images of Yesterday and Today: Beith, Barmill & Gateside: Precious Memories, which will be launched in Beith Library on Thursday 27 January 2010; recognises the hard work, attention to detail and research over the past nine months that have culminated in this publication; acknowledges the importance of local history and literature in educating local schoolchildren and considers them an invaluable source of the rich heritage of family and social history of an area; welcomes the fact that the proceeds from book sales will be used to fund what are considered many worthy local causes, including Barrmill Community Association, the Beith branch of the Ayrshire Cancer Support Group and Barrmill Lads & Lassies Burns Club, and wishes everyone involved with the book launch a highly enjoyable evening and great success in their bid to raise money for the aforementioned causes. Supported by: Bill Kidd, Jamie Hepburn, Pauline McNeill, Rob Gibson, Andrew Welsh, Willie Coffey, Shirley-Anne Somerville, Christina McKelvie, Michael Matheson, Christopher Harvie, Joe FitzPatrick, Gil Paterson, Bill Wilson, Stewart Stevenson
S3M-7785 Voices and Images of Yesterday (lodged on 25 January 2011) Stuart McMillan*

S3M-7785 Kenneth Gibson: Voices and Images of Yesterday—That the Parliament would like to congratulate Donald Reid, Beith Christian Action Group, Barrmill Jolly Beggars, Beith Camera Club and all others who have contributed to and made possible the publishing of the new local history book, Voices and Images of Yesterday and Today: Beith, Barmill & Gateside: Precious Memories, which will be launched in Beith Library on Thursday 27 January 2010; recognises the hard work, attention to detail and research over the past nine months that have culminated in this publication; acknowledges the importance of local history and literature in educating local schoolchildren and considers them an invaluable source of the rich heritage of family and social history of an area; welcomes the fact that the proceeds from book sales will be used to fund what are considered many worthy local causes, including Barrmill Community Association, the Beith branch of the Ayrshire Cancer Support Group and Barrmill Lads & Lassies Burns Club, and wishes everyone involved with the book launch a highly enjoyable evening and great success in their bid to raise money for the aforementioned causes. Supported by: Bill Kidd, Jamie Hepburn, Pauline McNeill, Rob Gibson, Andrew Welsh, Willie Coffey, Shirley-Anne Somerville, Christina McKelvie, Michael Matheson, Christopher Harvie, Joe FitzPatrick, Gil Paterson, Bill Wilson, Stewart Stevenson, Stuart McMillan
